A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Disappointing. What a mess of a plot with gaping plot holes. The only way to explain the critics’ higher ratings is that Disney paid them. Without getting into any spoilers\, it doesn’t look or feel like a Star Wars film. It’s a hybrid between Marvel’s Avengers and the recent Star Trek films. No questions are answered\, and it adds nothing to the epic tale. Indeed\, due to poor writing\, it seems like some questions will never be answered. There’s no soul and no sense of wonder to this film. There are story arcs and characters that are completely unnecessary. Given its 2 hour 31 minutes length\, a much better story could easily have been fashioned by cutting 40 minutes of pointless characters and plot lines. I had hoped following Episode VII\, bit this is the worst aberration of this great franchise.
